subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Optical Spiricom Captures
author: RetroCom
full_text:
----__Part.20080315145831.A0BE9A0C
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"

Hi Stefan,
 I'm attaching a very basic block diagram of the system. The initial tones are software generated. The software is called 'Audio Mulch'. The function to use is called '10 Harmonics'. I use a base frequency of 102hz. The waveform must be adjusted so the peaks are flat across the envelope, you will see what I mean when using the software, there is a free trial version of the software. The information on the SEC LED driver is available on Dr Stifflers web site. I do not have a link as the site pages seem to change frequently.

Here is another example from the system
"I'm glad your talking...and also watching"

Thanks for your interest,
Dave

--- yahoogroups@... wrote:

From: Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...>
To: RetroCom <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Optical Spiricom Captures
Date: Sat, 15 Mar 2008 13:45:53 +0100

Hi Dave,

what exactly did you do to get this original, monotonous "Spiricom
sound"? When I use Audition to mix the 13 tones, I get a sound like in
the attached file "13sine.wav". Did you also use a ring modulator?

Stefan

-- 

> A couple captures from tonights session with the optical based Spiricom.

> One the first one I get a Spirit who always pronounces my last name incorrectly.

> "Murwinski likes the future"

> The second capture is not robotic like the first.
> "Pray at the end of the world"

> Dave
